body_html:
@danmane Is this head already pushed? I just tried with 8c10acb , and after I delete event files, I still get errors:

ERROR:tensorflow:Unable to reload accumulator 'dbg_tcmalloc': [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/fast/cavitylearn/dataset-test/logs/dbg_tcmalloc' ERROR:tensorflow:Unable to reload accumulator 'dbg_tcmalloc/test': [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/fast/cavitylearn/dataset-test/logs/dbg_tcmalloc/test'

And the run still stays present in TensorBoard.

To put short, the behaviour is just like before. Is this intended?

What I meant is that instead of showing errors when event files disappear, TensorBoard should drop (or mark as invalid) the runs that have disappeared.

body:
@danmane Is this head already pushed? I just tried with 8c10acb2039af47f3a2940281b3e056e9789a82d , and after I delete event files, I still get errors:

`ERROR:tensorflow:Unable to reload accumulator 'dbg_tcmalloc': [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/fast/cavitylearn/dataset-test/logs/dbg_tcmalloc'
ERROR:tensorflow:Unable to reload accumulator 'dbg_tcmalloc/test': [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/fast/cavitylearn/dataset-test/logs/dbg_tcmalloc/test'`

And the run still stays present in TensorBoard.

To put short, the behaviour is just like before. Is this intended? 

What I meant is that instead of showing errors when event files disappear, TensorBoard should drop (or mark as invalid) the runs that have disappeared.
